title: Murder on the Bullet Express
description: A mysterious murder aboard the high-speed Bullet Express. Use your detective skills and English knowledge to solve the case!
setting: A luxurious steampunk train compartment filled with Victorian-era furnishings and mysterious passengers.

suspects.name: Professor LeStrange
suspects.description: A distinguished gentleman with wire-rimmed spectacles and a suspicious air.
suspects.appearance: Tall, thin man with grey beard, wearing a brown tweed jacket
suspects.personality: Scholarly but secretive, speaks in complex sentences
suspects.alibi: I was in the library car reading ancient texts until 11 PM
suspects.motive: The victim discovered his fake artifacts
suspects.secretHistory: Has been selling forged antiquities to museums

nodes.speaker: Professor LeStrange
nodes.text: Good evening, young detective. I was reading when I heard the commotion. Most distressing indeed.

responses.text: Where was you when the murder happened?

nodes.speaker: Professor LeStrange
nodes.text: Ancient Egyptian texts. Fascinating stuff about burial customs. I had been studying them for hours.

suspects.name: Chef Gaspard
suspects.description: A rotund chef with flour-stained apron and nervous disposition.
suspects.appearance: Short, heavyset man with a large mustache and chef's hat
suspects.personality: Anxious, speaks quickly, often mixes languages
suspects.alibi: I was preparing dessert in the kitchen until midnight
suspects.motive: The victim wrote a scathing review of his restaurant
suspects.secretHistory: His restaurant is facing bankruptcy due to bad reviews

nodes.speaker: Chef Gaspard
nodes.text: Ah, mon dieu! Such terrible news! I have been cooking all evening, preparing the most beautiful dessert.

responses.text: What kind of dessert were you making?

suspects.name: Captain Zane
suspects.description: A weathered captain with mechanical arm and steampunk goggles.
suspects.appearance: Tall woman with short hair, brass goggles, and a mechanical prosthetic arm
suspects.alibi: I was on the observation deck checking the weather instruments
suspects.motive: The victim was blackmailing her about a past accident
suspects.secretHistory: Her airship crashed years ago due to her mistake, killing passengers

nodes.speaker: Captain Zane
nodes.text: Detective! Good to see someone taking charge. I've been sailing these skies for twenty years - never seen anything like this.

responses.text: Have you ever seen a murder before?

clues.name: Bloody Knife
clues.description: A kitchen knife with blood stains. Could belong to the chef.
clues.revealsInfo: The murder weapon - but who used it?

clues.name: Torn Letter
clues.description: A letter ripped into pieces. Needs to be reconstructed.

clues.name: Ancient Egyptian Book
clues.description: A valuable book about burial customs, but something seems off.
clues.revealsInfo: The book is a fake - worth nothing

clues.name: Mechanical Gear
clues.description: A small brass gear from some kind of mechanism.
clues.revealsInfo: Fell from Captain Zane's mechanical arm during struggle

clues.name: Poisoned Wine Glass
clues.description: A wine glass with strange residue at the bottom.
clues.revealsInfo: Contains traces of a rare poison from the kitchen

clues.name: Hidden Flight Log
clues.description: A secret logbook hidden in the captain's quarters.
clues.revealsInfo: Records of the fatal airship crash and cover-up
clues.eslGrammarPoint: Past perfect for sequences of events

scenes.name: Luxury Carriage
scenes.description: An opulent train carriage with velvet seats, brass fixtures, and mysterious shadows.

hotspots.name: Victim's Body
hotspots.description: The victim lies motionless. What happened here?

hotspots.name: Dining Table
hotspots.description: An elegant dining table with the remains of dinner.

hotspots.name: Bookshelf
hotspots.description: Tall shelves filled with leather-bound books.

hotspots.name: Kitchen Door
hotspots.description: The door leading to the kitchen car.

minigames.name: Reconstruct the Torn Letter
minigames.description: Piece together the fragments to read the blackmail letter.

data.originalText: Dear Captain Zane, I know about the Aurora incident. Pay me 10,000 pounds or I will tell everyone about your mistake that killed innocent people. You have until we reach London. - Anonymous
data.solution: Dear Captain Zane, I know about the Aurora incident. Pay me 10,000 pounds or I will tell everyone about your mistake that killed innocent people. You have until we reach London. - Anonymous

eslFocus.description: Learn to use past simple, past continuous, and past perfect when describing events.
examples: The victim was reading when someone entered.
The chef had prepared dinner before the incident.
I saw the professor leave at midnight.

eslFocus.description: Essential vocabulary for discussing crimes and investigations.
Use modal verbs to express possibility, ability, and speculation about the crime.
examples: The killer could be anyone on the train.
Professor LeStrange might have a motive.
Captain Zane must have been hiding something.
